Event.name: Amassing
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Recipient</fen> (who may or may not be agentive) ends up in possession of a <fen>Mass_theme</fen> (which may be conceptualized as a single mass entity, or may be a group of individual entities). Some lexical units (e.g. <t>stockpile</t>) specifically indicate an intentional <fen>Recipient</fen>.
This frame differs from Gathering_up in that this frame refers specifically to the acquisition and (according to expectation) long-term possession of entities, rather than (as in the Gathering_up frame) simply talking about causing a group of entities to be located in the same place. In sum, Gathering_up concerns (co-)locations, but Amassing concerns possession.
<ex><fex name="Recipient">Bogs</fex> <t>accumulate</t> <fex name="Mass_theme">carbon</fex> <fex name="Duration">for thousands of years</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Recipient
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Recipient</fen> indicates the entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Mass_theme</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Mass_theme
Arg.definition: <def-root>The collection of objects that ends up in the <fen>Recipient</fen>'s possession.</def-root>

Arg.name: Source
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Source</fen> is the location that the <fen>Mass_theme</fen> formerly occupied. Persons that begin in possession of the <fen>Mass_theme</fen> may metonymically stand in for the <fen>Source</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The purpose for which an intentional amassment is performed.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> refers to the existing eventuality that the <fen>Recipient</fen> is responding to.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> is the action of the <fen>Recipient</fen> which results in their possession of the <fen>Mass_theme</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A description of the Amassing which is not covered by more specific FEs. It includes such specifications as comparisons to other events (<ment>similarly</ment>), rates of acquisition (<ment>slowly</ment>), and descriptions of the <fen>Recipient</fen> which also influence the action (<ment>eagerly</ment>).
<ex>If you press the show duplicates button, then all the redundant bookmarks that you have <fex name="man">haphazardly</fex> <t>accumulated</t> will be neatly displayed in alphabetical order .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The state that either the <fen>Recipient</fen> or the <fen>Mass_theme</fen> end up in after the acquisition.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE describes the length of time over which amassing occurs.
<ex>Bogs <t>accumulate</t> carbon <fex name="Dur">for thousands of years</fex> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>Some specification of the circumstances under which amassing occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Role
Arg.definition:
<def-root> <fen>Role</fen> is used for the capacity in which the <fen>Recipient</fen> amasses stuff, and is expressed in <ment>as</ment>-PPs.
<ex>By the time I was 16 , I was winning major contests , <t>amassing</t> a few quid in the bank <fex name="Rol">as a part-time model</fex> and walking as though I had a brush handle up my arse .</ex> </def-root>

lexUnit.name: accumulate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: gather together a number or quantity of.

lexUnit.name: stockpile.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: accumulate a large stock of.

lexUnit.name: hoard.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: amass and hide or store away.
